issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.summary: Clean up MRv1-specific terms from document

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
JobTracker should be ResourceManager, and {{hadoop mradmin}} should be {{yarn rmadmin}} in ServiceLevelAuth.md.
{code}
The service-level authorization configuration for the NameNode and JobTracker can be changed without restarting either of the Hadoop master daemons. The cluster administrator can change `$HADOOP_CONF_DIR/hadoop-policy.xml` on the master nodes and instruct the NameNode and JobTracker to reload their respective configurations via the `-refreshServiceAcl` switch to `dfsadmin` and `mradmin` commands respectively.

Refresh the service-level authorization configuration for the NameNode:

       $ bin/hadoop dfsadmin -refreshServiceAcl

Refresh the service-level authorization configuration for the JobTracker:

       $ bin/hadoop mradmin -refreshServiceAcl
{code}

comments.body: In addiiton, I'm thinking {{hadoop dfsadmin}} should be {{hdfs dfsadmin}}.
In addition to above mentioned,, Replaced tasktracker with NodeManager and replaced all the occurences of the Jobtracker to ResourceManager..
